0.Jean-Paul Sartre: Life has no meaning the moment you lose the illusion of being eternal.

1.Hermann Hesse: I realize today that nothing in the world is more distasteful to a man than to take the path that leads to himself.

2.Philip K. Dick: We are all insects. Groping towards something terrible or divine.

3.Søren Kierkegaard: With every increase in the degree of consciousness, and in proportion to that increase, the intensity of despair increases: the more consciousness the more intense the despair

4.Rob Ryser: At the end of time I want my art to stand up and my soul to bow down

5.Jack Kerouac: At night I closed my eyes and saw my bones threading the mud of my grave.

6.Saul Bellow: God may save all, but human rescue is only for a few.

7.Antoine de Saint-Exupéry: One needs, in order to exist, realities that last.

8.Jean-Paul Sartre: We do not know what we want and yet we are responsible for what we are - that is the fact.
